Description: Bowl sherd of Chian, possibly black-figured, Komast or Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice with top of foot; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky black; in centre, rosette with eight petals alternating added red and white; pair of faded white circles around rosette; exterior: band near top of sherd; lowest wall and outside of foot glazed.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (on the evidence of being included in Petrie 1886, pl. V.)
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd belongs to a Black Figure Komast chalice (no. 1526); she also places it in the Simple Animal Style (no. 1096). There is no evidence for black figure decoration on the sherd, although exterior and interior decorations are similar to those of a black-figure chalice from Chios, Lemos pl. 196, no. 1488. The decoration on both sides is also consistent with the earlier Chalice Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 302, no. 1096, p. 328, no. 1526)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1233) (phase 2)
